required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidural Analgesia and Troubles of Fetal Cardiaq Rythm : Effect of the Systemic Transfer of Ropivacaine and Sufentanil
clinical_study.official_title: Epidural Analgesia and Troubles of Fetal Cardiaq Rythm : Effect of the Systemic Transfer of Ropivacaine and Sufentanil

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the investigators study is to demonstrate the association between fetal cardiac rhythm abnormalies after epidural analgesia and the maternal systemic transfer of ropivacaine and/or sufentanil.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Plasmatic concentrations compared maternal ropivacaine based on the presence of abnormal fetal heart rate
primary_outcome.description: Maternal Plasmatic concentrations of ropivacaine will be measured in mg / liter of maternal blood and the median of each group will be compared by paired Wilcoxon test

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasmatic concentrations compared maternal sufentanil based on the presence of abnormal fetal heart rate
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal Plasmatic concentrations of sufentanil will be measured in mg / liter of maternal blood and the median of each group will be compared by paired Wilcoxon test

arm_group.description: patient at term, in spontanous labor with fetal cardiac rythm abnormally which occurs 30 minutes after the epidural analgesia induction
patient at term, spontaneous labor, without any fetal cardiac rhythm abnormalies during the 30 minutes after the epidural analgesia induction

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years old or more
- nulliparous
_ one fetus
- head first
- spontaneous labor
- epidural analgesia
- no fetal cardiac rhythm abnormalies before the epidural analgesia
- no active management of labor during 30 minutes after the epidural analgesia induction
- at term
- signature of the consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- pathological pregnancy
- low maternal blood pressure during the 30 minutes after the epidural analgesia
- uterin contraction which last for 5 minutes or more
- more than 6 uterin contractions during a 10 minutes period
- Ropivacaine contraindication
- sufentanil contraindication

facility.name: centre hospitalier universitaire de Rouen, Hopital Charles Nicolle
